intro: Sarcocephalus leichhardtii, commonly known as the African wild tea, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a slightly serrated edge. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are followed by bright red, fleshy berries. It is often found in rocky outcrops and dry woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. The leaves and fruits are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
